intro: Gamochaeta boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets surrounded by white to pale purple ray florets. Gamochaeta boliviensis is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
